question:
The data analysis team at Dion Home Appliance Company is outlining a new marketing campaign for their latest refrigerator.

Which of the following would provide a consumer with a report on demand?
explanation:
A self-service report, also known as an on-demand report, is one that is run directly by the consumer.

When consumers can leverage dashboards, or run their own reports from the systems the organization has purchased, they are doing self-service.

A static report does not update automatically.

A dynamic report is connected to the data and can be refreshed on-demand or automatically.

A point-in-time report reflects data at a specific moment, such as a day or month.

question:
Sanjay is a data analyst preparing a dashboard to deliver a presentation to his supervisor on sales at Dion Suit and Tie Co.

Before he begins creating the dashboard, what should he do as a best practice?
explanation:
Sanjay should plan the dashboard out with a mockup.

A mockup is a rough draft of a dashboard.

A wireframe is a series of mockups for connected screens.

Hard-coded filters are fixed and cannot be adjusted by the user.

Interactive filters allow users to adjust data views, but planning should come first.

question:
The data analysis team at Dion Home Appliance Company is outlining a new marketing campaign for their latest refrigerator.

Which of the following would an analyst on the campaign need to update manually?
explanation:
A static report is a report that does not update automatically.

A dynamic report is connected to live data and updates automatically or on demand.

A point-in-time report reflects data from a specific period.

A self-service report is accessed directly by the consumer and often includes real-time or refreshable data.

question: Arina will take her data+ exam next week. Please assist her studies by identifying the type of reporting that would be used to fulfill a one-time request that is time-sensitive.
explanation:
Ad hoc reports are generated to fulfill one-time requests and are typically time-sensitive.

Compliance reports are required for regulations.

Research-driven reports are used to influence or change business practices.

Operational reports track ongoing projects or performance metrics.

question:
Chelsea is preparing an annual report on employee satisfaction at the Dion Institute of Technology.

Data for this report is collected from an anonymous poll and requires supervisor endorsement for viewing.

This is an example of what?
explanation:
This is considered approval because employees must receive an endorsement from their supervisor.

Approval processes for data access vary across organisations.

Audience refers to those using the data.

A distribution list is the group that receives reports.

Access considerations involve permissions and data restrictions.

question:
Sanjay is a data analyst preparing a dashboard to deliver a presentation to his supervisor on sales at Dion Suit and Tie Co.

He’ll likely display the data with adjustable views and visuals which can narrow or expand the information the consumer sees.

What are these visuals known as?
explanation:
Interactive filters allow users to control the data they see through slicers or dropdowns.

Hard-coded filters are fixed and cannot be changed by the viewer.

Mockups and wireframes are planning tools, not interactive elements in the final dashboard.

question:
Timothy just earned his Data+ exam and has already been hired as a data analyst at the Dion Softdrink Co.

His company onboarding included training on dashboards, root cause analysis, self-service and operational reporting.

Which of the following would allow a consumer to receive information on-demand?
explanation:
Self-service reports allow consumers to generate data insights on demand.

Root cause analysis identifies problems after they happen.

Tactical dashboards monitor operational metrics over time.

Compliance reports fulfil regulatory needs.

question:
Sahra is a university student studying data science.

For her capstone project, she must use a visual that draws attention to words in a body of text but can’t include words like 'the', 'and', or 'so'.

Which of the following will she remove?
explanation:
Stop words are common words that appear frequently but offer little analytical value.

They are removed to enhance the relevance of text analysis and word cloud visuals.

Heat maps and infographics are unrelated to text cleaning.

question: Below is the example of which type of visual?
explanation:
A heat map uses colour gradients to highlight areas of interest or activity.

They are useful in data visualisation for quickly identifying high and low values in tables or geographical maps.

Word clouds and stop words relate to text analysis, not visual density.

question:
Bertha is creating a paginated report for her supervisor at Dion Extreme Sports Supply Corp.

Where would Bertha most likely place the title of the report and version number?
explanation:
The report header appears at the top of the first page and typically includes the report title and version.

Page headers repeat on each page and often include column headings.

Footers appear at the bottom of the page or the report and may include page numbers or references.

question:
Chelsea is preparing an annual report on employee satisfaction at the Dion Institute of Technology.

Data for this report is collected from an anonymous poll which is sent to every employee and then results are reviewed by executive management.

If an employee wants to view the results of the poll, they must demonstrate a need to know about the data.

This is considered what?
explanation:
This is an access consideration.

The approval process for data varies between organizations, and occasionally between departments.

Before an analyst begins reporting on data, they must consider access permissions for their audience.

It may be necessary to provide access to reports for individuals without access to raw data.

Audience and distribution list refer to who receives or uses the data, while 'approval' is more formalized permission to begin reporting.

question:
Jeremy is a senior data analyst that gives a quarterly briefing to executives at the Dion Bubblegum Company.

During the presentation, he provides the executives a printed document with detailed information so they can dive deeper into specific analysis not covered with any visuals he uses during the brief.

What is Jeremy handing out to the executives?
explanation:
Jeremy is handing out a paginated report.

A paginated report is a multi-page report not suitable for dashboards but ideal for printed handouts.

Dashboards are interactive and visual.

Spreadsheets are editable data tables, often for internal use.

Recurring reports are scheduled, not necessarily suitable for executive handouts.

question:
Dante has just created a report for the Dion Shipping and Logistics Company.

Where would he provide additional details and information related to this report?
explanation:
He would include this information in the appendix.

An appendix provides additional details or documentation related to the report.

Visual filters and tooltips provide insights within visuals.

Drill-through capability allows for deeper analysis by interacting with the data, not for supplementary documentation.

question:
Dante has just created a dashboard for the Dion Shipping and Logistics Company.

In order to create the best user experience, he wants the audience to be able to select a value which they can manipulate for a deeper meaning of the data.

Which of the following should he employ to enable this capability?
explanation:
He should use drill-through capability.

This feature allows users to click a value and view deeper, contextual data on a new page or section.

It enables self-service exploration and deeper analysis without needing to manually filter across pages.

Tooltips and visual filters help but are not as interactive or detailed.

question: Given visual is an example of?
explanation:
This is a word cloud.

A word cloud is a visual representation of text where the size of each word indicates its frequency or importance.

Stop words are filtered out before creating this visual.

Infographics are broader data visuals, and heat maps focus on highlighting areas using colour.

question:
Jordy is preparing a visual for his data science team and wants to ensure that it is easily understood when he presents it.

Which of the following should he incorporate to assist his audience?
explanation:
Jordy should incorporate a legend.

A legend explains which colours, lines, or patterns in a visual correspond to which values or categories.

This improves clarity and understanding.

Style guides relate to branding, not data clarity.

Captioning renames fields, and fonts affect readability, not interpretation of visuals.

question:
Sasha is a data analyst that has just finished profiling a new data set.

She manipulates the data into ascending order to make it easier to visualize.

This action is related to which of the following?
explanation:
This action is related to natural order.

Sorting data in ascending or descending order helps visual clarity and comprehension.

Natural order makes data more interpretable.

Data models define structure and relationships.

Field definitions describe what each field means.

Field attributes define field types like dimension or measure.

question: Given below is the visual ___.
explanation:
The image is a bar chart.

Bar charts show data distribution with categories on the y-axis and values on the x-axis.

They are ideal for comparing discrete categories.

Column charts are similar but flip the axes.

Pie charts show percentage breakdowns, and treemaps use nested rectangles for hierarchical data.

question:
The Dion Institute for Public Wellbeing has just released an annual publicly available report.

While reading the report, a student sees the year marked on the report header.

This is most closely related to which of the following?
explanation:
This is an example of a version number.

Version numbers document which iteration of a report is being viewed.

They help readers determine if they're reviewing the most recent data.

References are for sources, watermarks mark sensitive or confidential content, and narratives summarise content.

question: This is an example of ________.
explanation:
The image is a pie chart.

Pie charts display data as slices of a whole, making it easy to understand proportions.

Bar and column charts are better for showing distributions.

Tree maps represent hierarchical data using nested rectangles.

question:
Demitry is a data scientist at a regional university who is assigned to the administrative faculty of the school.

He needs to update his supervisor on a campaign to increase student enrollment.

Which of the following would he use to deliver his findings?
explanation:
He would use an operational report.

Operational reports monitor ongoing efforts and key performance indicators.

Compliance reports meet legal or regulatory standards.

Ad hoc reports address one-time or urgent requests.

Research-driven reports are used to influence policy or long-term business strategies.

question:
Jose is preparing a presentation for his supervisor on last quarter’s sales.

Which visual would allow him to display the distribution of data with categories of information on the y-axis and discrete numerical measurements on the x-axis?
explanation:
A bar chart would be appropriate.

It places categories on the y-axis and values on the x-axis, making comparisons clear.

Column charts flip the axes.

Pie charts show proportions, and tree maps show nested hierarchical relationships.

question:
Jordy is preparing a dashboard for his data science team and wants to ensure the other analysts have the most detailed understandings of each field.

Which of the following should he incorporate to accomplish this?
explanation:
Jordy should incorporate captioning.

Captioning allows analysts to provide more meaningful field names in a report or dashboard.

Legends explain visuals, not fields.

Style guides are for branding, and serif fonts are for text readability, not field clarity.

question: Which markup language is primarily used for data transfers and uses custom tags?
explanation:
XML is used primarily for data transfers and supports custom tags to structure data.

JSON is a data format, not a markup language.

HTML displays web content, and SGML is the parent of both HTML and XML.

question:
Jet is working with boolean field data and must identify the following as boolean values.

Please select all examples of boolean values:
explanation:
1/0, True/False, On/Off, and Yes/No are examples of boolean values, representing binary logic.

500 is a number and 9/20/1984 is a date, not boolean.

question:
Angel is the IT director for a nation-wide pet clothing consignment store.

She has directed her data architects to create separate databases for clothing sales designed for each kind of common household pet to keep company systems organized.

The cat, dog, bird, and rodent departments must all have separate databases to accomplish this.

Which technology would best support Angel’s requirement?
explanation:
Angel’s requirement would be best satisfied with a data mart.

Data marts are departmental databases that serve specific business units.

Data warehouses store data across the entire organisation.

Data lakes store raw structured and unstructured data.

Data lakehouses combine features of both lakes and warehouses.

question:
A restaurant is hosting a band next weekend and expects many people to attend the concert.

Which of the following is a quantitative value?
options: The band's name: Dion and the Jets
explanation:
The building's maximum capacity is a quantitative value because it is measurable and numeric.

The band’s name, food specials, and restaurant location are qualitative descriptors.

question:
Harshit is a data analyst team leader who works closely with data architects and the IT director of his company.

During a meeting, he is asked whether or not his team would benefit from an additional database that uses columns and rows to store data.

What type of database is Harshit being asked about?
explanation:
Harshit is being asked about a relational database.

Relational databases use tables with rows and columns.

Non-relational databases do not use tabular schemas.

Nominal refers to data types, not databases.

Perpendicular is not a valid database type.

question:
This data structure uses tags and attributes that group the data and describe its storage methods.

These tags allow analysts to search, view, and transform the data.

What data structure is being described?
explanation:
Semi-structured data uses tags and attributes to provide structure without the strict format of relational tables.

It includes formats like XML and JSON.

Tagged data is not a standalone classification.

Structured data fits neatly in tables.

Unstructured data lacks a predefined format.

question:
Mateo is updating Dion University student records and must remove student IDs for individuals who have disenrolled from their programs.

Which of the following can Mateo do to remove the student ID records from multiple tables simultaneously?
explanation:
Mateo can use cascade delete to remove related records across multiple tables.

When the primary record is deleted, all linked foreign key records are also deleted.

Cascade update changes key values, not removes them.

The other options are not standard SQL operations.

question:
Tia is a PhD student working on her doctorate in molecular biology.

She is graduating in less than 4 months and has already defended her dissertation. Occasionally, she reminisces about her time in graduate school, college, and high school.

Her education followed a set progression. What would this progression be considered?
explanation:
Tia’s education followed an ordinal path because it had a set progression.

She had to complete each level before advancing to the next. This order matters, making it ordinal data rather than nominal or simply qualitative.

question: In which of the following data quality dimensions is the data following a set of standard data definitions like data type, size, and format (e.g. date of birth of customer is in the format “mm/dd/yyyy”)?
explanation:
Conformity means the data adheres to defined formats, types, and structures.

This ensures consistency in how data is stored and interpreted across systems.

For example, enforcing a date format like 'mm/dd/yyyy' demonstrates conformity.

question: Which of the following ways can be used to achieve the desired quality output for standardized names in a master data management (MDM) architecture? (Select TWO)
options: Use the same locales to standardize names properly
Define and apply customized schemes to standardize differently spelled words to common words (e.g. Assoc, Assocn. and Assn. to Association)
Use the different locales to standardize names properly
Don't define and apply customized schemes to standardize differently spelled words
correctAnswer: Define and apply customized schemes to standardize differently spelled words to common words (e.g. Assoc, Assocn. and Assn. to Association)
Use the different locales to standardize names properly
explanation:
Effective MDM for names includes:

- Using different locales to account for regional language differences.
- Applying customized schemes to unify abbreviations and alternate spellings.

Both help ensure standardized, accurate records.

question:
A data analyst wants to measure how well a piece of information reflects reality.

Which of the following data quality dimensions does the data analyst need to assess?
explanation:
Data accuracy refers to how well a data value reflects the real-world object or event it represents.

Accurate data supports correct decisions and reliable analysis.

question:
A financial analyst gathers information, assembles spreadsheets, and writes reports.

He wants every time he makes changes to the files, these will be synced and updated across all of his devices.

Which of the following storage environments does the analyst need to save his file?
explanation:
Cloud storage enables file syncing and updates across multiple devices in real time.

It provides accessibility, redundancy, and collaborative functionality beyond what local storage offers.

question:
The ACME Corporation hired an analyst to detect data quality issues in their excel documents.

Which of the following are the most common issues? (Select TWO)
explanation:
The most common data quality issues in Excel include:

- Misspellings, which lead to inconsistencies in records
- Duplicates, which result in skewed or inflated analysis

These require careful attention to ensure data integrity.

question:
The Acme Corporation is working on a new data warehouse and business intelligence (DW/BI) project.

They need to uncover data quality issues in data sources, and what needs to be corrected in Extract, transform, load (ETL).

Which of the following methods should they use to validate the data?
explanation:
Data profiling is the process of reviewing data sources to understand structure, content, and quality.

It helps identify issues in source data that must be addressed in ETL during a data warehousing project.

question: Which of the following types of vulnerability scans should an organization perform as they store credit card information that follows the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS)?
explanation:
Organizations storing credit card data must run compliance scans to meet PCI DSS requirements.

These scans ensure the system adheres to required security protocols and can pass regulatory audits.

question:
Cardinality refers to the maximum number of times an instance in one entity can relate to instances of another entity while ordinality is the minimum number of times an instance in one entity can be associated with an instance in the related entity.

(Correct or Incorrect)
explanation:
Correct.

Cardinality defines the maximum relationships between entities.

Ordinality defines the minimum, indicating whether a relationship is optional or mandatory.

question: Which of the following policies is a set of guidelines that helps organizations keep track of how long information must be kept and how to dispose of the information when it’s no longer needed?
explanation:
A data retention policy outlines how long data should be stored and the rules for safely disposing of it.

This helps ensure compliance with data protection and privacy regulations.

question:
A company uses AWS cloud technologies for its scalability and high-performance features.

The company wants to give access to software engineers to control the AWS infrastructure and deny access to the rest employees.

Which of the following access control method the company SHOULD use to fulfill the requirement?
explanation:
Role-based access control (RBAC) assigns permissions to users based on their role in the organisation.

This method ensures that only software engineers can access AWS infrastructure while restricting others.

It offers a secure, manageable, and scalable solution for access management.

question: Which of the following reports reflects a specific period for a data set?
explanation:
A point-in-time report reflects data from a specific date or time range (e.g., a day, month, or year).

It is useful for retrospective analysis and reporting within a defined time window.

question:
Jean is preparing a monthly report on business expenses at the Dion Institute of Technology.

This report is sent to management at the institute who are all on the same email alias.

This email alias would be considered which of the following?
explanation:
An email alias that includes multiple recipients is known as a distribution list.

It is used to send reports or communications to a predefined group of people.

question:
Sasha is adding clarifying information to a data set so that each area is easily understandable to a new analyst.

This information is known as what?
explanation:
Field definitions provide clear explanations for each field in a dataset.

This helps new analysts understand what the data represents and how it should be interpreted.

question: This is an example of, which type of visual.
explanation:
A filled map visually represents data across geographic regions by shading areas based on value.

This makes it easy to spot patterns or differences across locations.

question:
Reed is a data analyst at Dion Softdrink Distributors.

He has been asked to deliver a presentation to senior executives next week that uses visuals to help identify data outliers.

What has Reed been asked to use?
explanation:
Scatter plots are ideal for identifying data outliers and relationships between two variables.

Each point represents a data pair, making anomalies easily visible.

question:
Sahra is a university student studying data science.

For her capstone project, she must use a visual that draws attention with color scales.

Which of the following will she use?
explanation:
Heat maps use colour to indicate intensity or concentration of values in a dataset.

They're useful for drawing visual attention to patterns or anomalies.

question:
Jordy is a new analyst preparing a dashboard for his data science team and wants to make sure he follows the branding rules within his company.

What should he use to accomplish this?
explanation:
Style guides contain branding rules such as colour schemes, logos, fonts, and naming conventions.

Following them ensures visual consistency across dashboards and reports.

question:
Tommy is a data analyst that is preparing a dashboard to present to his coworkers on their team’s cloud service usage.

He needs to display information in columns and rows and include aggregate information.

Which of the following should he use to accomplish this?
explanation:
A table is used to display structured data in rows and columns with the option to include subtotals or aggregates.

It’s best for straightforward data presentation in a familiar layout.

question:
Sasha is preparing for her Data+ exam next week.

Which of the following is repeatedly run on certain dates or specific times for an individual, team, or organization?
explanation:
A recurring report is scheduled to run automatically at regular intervals (e.g., daily, weekly, monthly).

This ensures stakeholders receive up-to-date information consistently.
